Description: Tapestry square applied and sewn to an undyed linen, plain weave textile; the tapestry decoration is a bird with a beige, light blue and blue plummage, and beige and pink legs and beak; mauve, beige and yellow eye; oriented to the right; in the top left hand corner is a yellow ankh within a vegetal and floral wreath/crown; on a purple background; the square is framed by a beige plain band and a red plain band; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/22), weft-undyed linen (S/11); tapestry on single threads: warp-undyed linen (S/10), weft-beige, yellow, pink, mauve, purple, red, light and blue, light and dark green wool (S/60); oversewing threads in red wool (S spun Z ply/S); edges cut and ragged
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015-2016, Oct 29-Feb 7, London, BM, G35, Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs.
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
